channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10835] DBE encode path improvements
item.description:
Here 1st we write KVs (Cells) into a buffer and then passed to DBE encoder. Encoder again reads kvs one by one from the buffer and encodes and creates a new buffer.
There is no need to have this model now. Previously we had option of no encode in disk and encode only in cache. At that time the read buffer from a HFile block was passed to this and encodes.
So encode cell by cell can be done now. Making this change will need us to have a NoOp DBE impl which just do the write of a cell as it is with out any encoding.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: As said in HBASE-10801 was planning to change the interface of DBEs and address usage of cell. Are you going to change the code without cells? Intention of HBASE-10801 was mainly changing the interface and then doing any improvements on that. (and while doing that I thought the related code also would change may be ending up as what this JIRA suggests). This also includes the read path.
Thought the change in write path will be bigger and it is not so cell specific so handle in a seperate jira. HBASE-10801 , therea are suggestions on the read path.
Want to see a QA run on this change

This message is automatically generated.
Any chance for reviews?
I have done some. Will do it today or tomorrow again.

+@InterfaceAudience.Private

+public class EncoderPoolImpl implements EncoderPool {

+

+  private List<PrefixTreeEncoder> unusedEncoders = new ArrayList<PrefixTreeEncoder>();

+

+  @Override

+  public PrefixTreeEncoder checkOut(OutputStream outputStream, boolean includeMvccVersion) {

+    PrefixTreeEncoder encoder = null;

+    synchronized (this) {

+      if (!unusedEncoders.isEmpty()) {

+        encoder = unusedEncoders.remove(0);

+      }

+    }

+    if (encoder == null) {

+      encoder = new PrefixTreeEncoder(outputStream, includeMvccVersion);

+    } else {

+      encoder.reset(outputStream, includeMvccVersion);

+    }

+    return encoder;

+  }

+

+  @Override

+  public void checkIn(PrefixTreeEncoder encoder) {

+    synchronized (this) {

+      this.unusedEncoders.add(encoder);

+    }

+  }

+}

instead of a plain ArrayList for unusedEncoders, maybe you should use a LinkedBlockingQueue? then you wouldn't have to synchronize the methods
Anoop, i don't see anything wrong but could get a better feel for it on reviewboard. Let me know if that's possible or if I missed a review request.
Sure I will put it in RB.

https://reviews.apache.org/r/20936
Also comment from Matt is fixed in this version.
